name: REQUIREMENTS / REFERENCE: Project Safety Plan, Project Environment Plan
• All site personnel inducted, required SWMS completed and signed, Safety Plan approved
• ERSED controls installed on site, air quality visually monitored for dust etc due to construction activities, Environment Plan approved
• Contact DBYD and complete excavation permit, extent of works set out with survey pegs
• Upon reaching designed floor level, an inspection between Principal & contractor of the foundation is required
• Promptly notify the Principal of areas determined to be unsuitable
• WITNESS POINT: Notify Client 3 days prior to inspection of foundation
• HOLD POINT: Where unsuitable material is found, excavate to the extent directed by the Client and inspect prior to backfilling
• HOLD POINT: In the event of recompacting, rip material in the floor to a minimum depth of 150mm. Inspection of ripped or loosened material to be carried out with Client
• HOLD POINT:  Recompact cutting floor and notify Principal of completion before placing subsequent layers. Inspection of compacted floor
• HOLD POINT: Inspection of subgrade/pavement movement observed under roll test – after wet material and subsoil treatment applied.
• WITNESS POINT: Survey to mark intersection line. Inspection of intersection line between cutting and embankment
• HOLD POINT: Inspection of embankment foundation area following removal of topsoil

• HOLD POINT:  If either loosen and compact, bridging layer, working platform, geotextile/geogrid layer, drainage layer or other treatment is proposed, submit details 3 days before additional treatments
10 - Inspection of Trimmed and Compacted Embankment
• HOLD POINT: Inspection of trimmed and compacted embankment prior to placement of subsequent layers
• HOLD POINT: Inspection of subgrade/pavement movement observed under roll test – after wet material and subsoil treatment applied.
• HOLD POINT: For slopes steeper than 1:1, Client to inspect the stability of the batter before excavation below it
QA ENGINEER / SPE / PE SIGN OFF
